main event: A very bright orange-red object was observed in the eastern sky for approximately 3 hours, moving at a fast rate, descending and ascending.
interesting points: The object was observed for around 3 hours, but due to lack of definite data, the evaluation was inconclusive.
The object appeared as a very bright orange-red light, brighter than the brightest stars.
The object moved behind and in front of clouds during the observation period.
The witness estimated the object's highest point in the sky to be around 67 degrees elevation.
Around 12:00, a small white dot was observed disappearing into the larger object.
